trans-unit.source: dotnet-install scripts reference
trans-unit.target: dotnet-install scripts reference

trans-unit.source: NAME
trans-unit.target: NAME

trans-unit.source: dotnet-install.ps1 | dotnet-install.sh - script used to install the Command Line Interface (CLI) tools and shared runtime
trans-unit.target: dotnet-install.ps1 | dotnet-install.sh - script used to install the Command Line Interface (CLI) tools and shared runtime

trans-unit.source: SYNOPSIS
trans-unit.target: SYNOPSIS

trans-unit.source: Windows:
trans-unit.target: Windows:

trans-unit.source: OS X/Linux:
trans-unit.target: OS X/Linux:

trans-unit.source: DESCRIPTION
trans-unit.target: DESCRIPTION

trans-unit.source: The `dotnet-install` scripts are used to perform a non-admin install of the CLI toolchain and the shared runtime.
trans-unit.target: The `dotnet-install` scripts are used to perform a non-admin install of the CLI toolchain and the shared runtime.

trans-unit.source: You can download the scripts from our [CLI GitHub repo](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/tree/rel/1.0.0-preview2/scripts/obtain).
trans-unit.target: You can download the scripts from our [CLI GitHub repo](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/tree/rel/1.0.0-preview2/scripts/obtain).

trans-unit.source: Their main use case is to help with automation scenarios and non-admin installations.
trans-unit.target: Their main use case is to help with automation scenarios and non-admin installations.

trans-unit.source: There are two scripts, one for PowerShell that works on Windows and a bash script that works on Linux/OS X. They both have the same behavior.
trans-unit.target: There are two scripts, one for PowerShell that works on Windows and a bash script that works on Linux/OS X. They both have the same behavior.

trans-unit.source: Bash script also "understands" PowerShell switches so you can use them across the board.
trans-unit.target: Bash script also "understands" PowerShell switches so you can use them across the board.

trans-unit.source: Installation scripts will download the ZIP/tarball file from the CLI build drops and will proceed to install it in either the default location or in a location specified by `--install-dir`.
trans-unit.target: Installation scripts will download the ZIP/tarball file from the CLI build drops and will proceed to install it in either the default location or in a location specified by `--install-dir`.

trans-unit.source: By default, the installation script will download the SDK and install it; if you want to get just the shared runtime, you can specify the `--shared-runtime` argument.
trans-unit.target: By default, the installation script will download the SDK and install it; if you want to get just the shared runtime, you can specify the `--shared-runtime` argument.

trans-unit.source: By default, the script will add the install location to the $PATH for the current session.
trans-unit.target: By default, the script will add the install location to the $PATH for the current session.

trans-unit.source: This can be overridden if the `--no-path` argument is used.
trans-unit.target: This can be overridden if the `--no-path` argument is used.

trans-unit.source: Before running the script, please install all the required [dependencies](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/Documentation/prereqs.md).
trans-unit.target: Before running the script, please install all the required [dependencies](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/Documentation/prereqs.md).

trans-unit.source: You can install a specific version using the `--version` argument.
trans-unit.target: You can install a specific version using the `--version` argument.

trans-unit.source: The version needs to be specified as 3-part version (for example 1.0.0-13232).
trans-unit.target: The version needs to be specified as 3-part version (for example 1.0.0-13232).

trans-unit.source: If omitted, it will default to the first global.json file found in the hierarchy above the folder where the script was invoked in that contains the `sdkVersion` property.
trans-unit.target: If omitted, it will default to the first global.json file found in the hierarchy above the folder where the script was invoked in that contains the `sdkVersion` property.

trans-unit.source: If that is not present, it will use Latest.
trans-unit.target: If that is not present, it will use Latest.

trans-unit.source: You can also use this script to get the SDK or shared runtime debug binaries with debug symbols by using the `--debug` argument.
trans-unit.target: You can also use this script to get the SDK or shared runtime debug binaries with debug symbols by using the `--debug` argument.

trans-unit.source: If you do not do this on first install and realize you do need debug symbols later on, you can re-run the script with this argument and the version of the bits you installed.
trans-unit.target: If you do not do this on first install and realize you do need debug symbols later on, you can re-run the script with this argument and the version of the bits you installed.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: Options are different between script implementations.
trans-unit.target: Options are different between script implementations.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell (Windows)
trans-unit.target: PowerShell (Windows)

trans-unit.source: Which channel (for example, "future", "preview", "production") to install from.
trans-unit.target: Which channel (for example, "future", "preview", "production") to install from.

trans-unit.source: The default value is "Production".
trans-unit.target: The default value is "Production".

trans-unit.source: Which version of CLI to install; you need to specify the version as 3-part version (i.e. 1.0.0-13232).
trans-unit.target: Which version of CLI to install; you need to specify the version as 3-part version (i.e. 1.0.0-13232).

trans-unit.source: If omitted, it will default to the first global.json that contains the sdkVersion property; if that is not present, it will use Latest.
trans-unit.target: If omitted, it will default to the first global.json that contains the sdkVersion property; if that is not present, it will use Latest.

trans-unit.source: Path to install to.
trans-unit.target: Path to install to.

trans-unit.source: The directory is created if it doesn't exist.
trans-unit.target: The directory is created if it doesn't exist.

trans-unit.source: The default value is `%LocalAppData%\.dotnet`.
trans-unit.target: The default value is `%LocalAppData%\.dotnet`.

trans-unit.source: **true** to indicate that larger packages containing debugging symbols should be used; otherwise, **false**.
trans-unit.target: **true** to indicate that larger packages containing debugging symbols should be used; otherwise, **false**.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **false**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **false**.

trans-unit.source: **true** to indicate that the prefix/installdir are not exported to the path for the current session; otherwise, **false**.
trans-unit.target: **true** to indicate that the prefix/installdir are not exported to the path for the current session; otherwise, **false**.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **false**, that is, the PATH is modified.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **false**, that is, the PATH is modified.

trans-unit.source: This makes the CLI tools available immediately after install.
trans-unit.target: This makes the CLI tools available immediately after install.

trans-unit.source: **true** to install just the shared runtime bits; **false** to install the entire SDK.
trans-unit.target: **true** to install just the shared runtime bits; **false** to install the entire SDK.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **false**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **false**.

trans-unit.source: Bash (OS X/Linux)
trans-unit.target: Bash (OS X/Linux)

trans-unit.source: Which channel (for example "future", "preview", "production") to install from.
trans-unit.target: Which channel (for example "future", "preview", "production") to install from.

trans-unit.source: The default value is "Production".
trans-unit.target: The default value is "Production".

trans-unit.source: Which version of CLI to install; you need to specify the version as 3-part version (i.e. 1.0.0-13232).
trans-unit.target: Which version of CLI to install; you need to specify the version as 3-part version (i.e. 1.0.0-13232).

trans-unit.source: If omitted, it will default to the first global.json that contains the sdkVersion property; if that is not present, it will use Latest.
trans-unit.target: If omitted, it will default to the first global.json that contains the sdkVersion property; if that is not present, it will use Latest.

trans-unit.source: Path to where to install.
trans-unit.target: Path to where to install.

trans-unit.source: The directory is created if it doesn't exist.
trans-unit.target: The directory is created if it doesn't exist.

trans-unit.source: The default value is `$HOME/.dotnet`.
trans-unit.target: The default value is `$HOME/.dotnet`.

trans-unit.source: **true** to indicate that larger packages containing debugging symbols should be used; otherwise, **false**.
trans-unit.target: **true** to indicate that larger packages containing debugging symbols should be used; otherwise, **false**.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **false**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **false**.

trans-unit.source: **true** to indicate that the prefix/installdir are not exported to the path for the current session; otherwise, **false**.
trans-unit.target: **true** to indicate that the prefix/installdir are not exported to the path for the current session; otherwise, **false**.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **false**, that is, the PATH is modified.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **false**, that is, the PATH is modified.

trans-unit.source: This makes the CLI tools available immediately after install.
trans-unit.target: This makes the CLI tools available immediately after install.

trans-unit.source: **true** to install just the shared runtime bits; **false** to install the entire SDK.
trans-unit.target: **true** to install just the shared runtime bits; **false** to install the entire SDK.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **false**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **false**.
